words.definition: A bill is a statement of money owed for goods or a service.
words.example: I have so many bills that I do not know how to pay for them all.

words.definition: A boundary is the line where one area of land stops and another begins.
words.example: This fence shows the boundary between our yard and yours.

words.definition: Chaos is a situation that is confusing and not ordered.
words.example: His presentation was in chaos. I couldn’t understand what he meant.

words.definition: If a person is consistent, they keep the same behavior or attitude.
words.example: Sara comes in every day and is our most consistent worker.

words.definition: A cyclone is a large storm with very strong winds.
words.example: The cyclone caused a lot of damage to the coastal towns.

words.definition: If someone or something is doomed, it is certain to fail or be destroyed.
words.example: The project was doomed from the beginning because of a lack of money.

words.definition: An heir is a person who will receive money or a title when someone dies.
words.example: The prince is the heir to the throne.

words.definition: Martial relates to war or the military.
words.example: Karate is a well-known martial art.

words.definition: Organic describes things that come from living things.
words.example: The farmer uses only organic fertilizers for his crops.

words.definition: Poultry are birds such as chickens and ducks that are kept for their meat or eggs.
words.example: The farm raises poultry for local restaurants.

words.definition: To scramble is to move quickly using your hands and feet.
words.example: The children scrambled up the hill to see the view.

words.definition: A sergeant is a rank of officer in the army or police.
words.example: The sergeant gave orders to the soldiers.

words.definition: Sheer is used to emphasize the size or degree of something.
words.example: The sheer size of the mountain was impressive.

words.definition: A stance is an attitude or opinion about something.
words.example: The politician’s stance on the new law was very clear.

words.definition: A telegraph is an old system for sending messages over long distances.
words.example: In the past, people used the telegraph to send urgent news.

words.definition: A textile is a type of cloth or woven fabric.
words.example: The country is famous for its beautiful textiles.

words.definition: A tornado is a very strong wind that moves in a circle.
words.example: The tornado destroyed several houses in its path.

words.definition: A typhoon is a violent tropical storm with very strong winds.
words.example: The typhoon caused flooding throughout the island.

words.definition: To wail is to make a long, high cry of sadness or pain.
words.example: The baby began to wail when it was hungry.

words.definition: A wardrobe is a large cupboard for keeping clothes in.
words.example: She has a very large wardrobe full of expensive clothes.
